pros: Very supportive work environment, management cares about employees well-being. Great opportunities to collaborate with other professionals in the clinic.
cons: The company is rapidly growing, so there is frequent change. Management communicates well and supports employees through frequent changes.

job_title: Prefer To Remain Anonymous in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Compassionate, mission driven organization. Many staff are committed to the patients and community
cons: Inexperienced senior leadership, favoritism, lack of vision, no follow through, low pay for clinic staff, corporate staff earn much higher salaries. Very high turnover rate.

pros: if you like to be busy 110% of the time and do work outside of hours, it is a good job
cons: No boundaries, excessive patient caseloads, no time to document, teams change every few months, supervisors change every few months, provider turnover is the only thing consistent

pros: Willing to accept candidates with minimal experience. Stepping stone for some.
cons: Leadership at the top have jumped ship. Middle Management seems to allow issues to continue so they have job security.

pros: Holistic approach to behavioral health, varied population of patients, supportive environment.
cons: Limited behavioral health resources, challenges and barriers associated with community mental health/ medicaid population

pros: Pay is decent for work but that has changed as of late

pros: Their mission statement is good no doubt about that, poor execution.
cons: The pay is low even for a non-profit, not worth the hassle. Poor BI training . Middle Management and some executives are very self involved. Employer plays favorites. Middle management needs to be trained on how to be better managers.

cons: Focused very heavily on patient numbers/encounters, tough patient population and not enough time for visits leads to high burn out, high turn over in all positions including management
